snippet: The agency has fallen under scrutiny as more than 60 million vehicles were recalled in the United States last year, double the previous record set in 2004.
abstract: Obama administration proposes in its budget to nearly triple funding for defect investigations at National Highway Traffic Safety Administration, and increase agency's total budget 20 percent annually over six years.
lead_paragraph: The agency has fallen under scrutiny as more than 60 million vehicles were recalled in the United States last year, double the previous record set in 2004.

headline.main: Obama Budget’s Call for Increased Funding for N.H.T.S.A. Faces Uncertainty
headline.print_headline: Obama Budget Calls for N.H.T.S.A. Funds
